meanings.definition: The property of certain gels or fluids that become less viscous when agitated or stressed, and return to a more solid state when left undisturbed.
meanings.sent1: The thixotropy of the gel allowed it to flow easily when mixed but then set firmly in place.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the thixotropy of the fluid as it transformed from a runny consistency to a solid form.
meanings.sent3: The thixotropy of the slime made it seem like a magical substance that could change its state at will.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions exhibited thixotropy, appearing calm on the surface but solidifying into deep feelings when left alone.
meanings.sent5: The thixotropy of the clay made it a fascinating material to work with, shifting between soft and firm with each touch.
